title: How to Change the Default Installation Location on Windows 10

steps.title: Go to the Settings panel.
steps.content: Go to the Settings panel. Open the Start menu by clicking on the Windows icon and hit the Settings gear icon from the left side. Alternatively, press ⊞ Win + I to quickly launch the Settings panel.

steps.title: Click on the System settings.
steps.content: Click on the System settings. It's the first option with a laptop icon.

steps.title: Select the Storage option from the left panel.
steps.content: Select the Storage option from the left panel. It will be the sixth option in there.

steps.title: Navigate to the “More storage settings” section.
steps.content: Navigate to the “More storage settings” section. Click on the Change where new content is saved option, under the More storage settings title.

steps.title: Select a drive from the New apps will save to box.
steps.content: Select a drive from the New apps will save to box. Click on the This PC (C:) box and choose a drive from the list. Make sure that your drive has the essential storage to install new apps in the future.

steps.title: Click on the Apply button to save your changes.
steps.content: Click on the Apply button to save your changes. Now you can install Windows Store apps on your desired hard drive. Finished!
